intro: Helleborine × schmalhausenii, commonly known as the hybrid helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, greenish-white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky areas. It is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its ornamental value in gardens. Helleborine × schmalhausenii is also valued for its role in ecological systems, providing nectar for pollinators.
